TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit UnvalidatedRequestValuesBase extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for classes that provide access to HTTP request values without triggering ASP.NET request validation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For information about request validation, see <xref:System.Web.UnvalidatedRequestValues>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called from constructors in derived classes in order to initialize the class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Cookies As HttpCookieCollection
public: virtual property System::Web::HttpCookieCollection ^ Cookies { System::Web::HttpCookieCollection ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the collection of cookies that the client sent, without triggering ASP.NET request validation.
Docs.value: The cookies from the HTTP request.

block.para: If you override this property in a derived class, you must manually check the data for potential cross-site scripting attacks.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Files As HttpFileCollectionBase
public: virtual property System::Web::HttpFileCollectionBase ^ Files { System::Web::HttpFileCollectionBase ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the collection of files that the client uploaded, without triggering ASP.NET request validation.
Docs.value: The files from the HTTP request.

block.para: If you override this property in a derived class, you must manually check the data for potential cross-site scripting attacks.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Form As NameValueCollection

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the collection of form variables that the client submitted, without triggering ASP.NET request validation.
Docs.value: The form variables from the HTTP request.

block.para: If you override this property in a derived class, you must manually check the data for potential cross-site scripting attacks.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Headers As NameValueCollection

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the collection of HTTP headers that the client sent, without triggering ASP.NET request validation.
Docs.value: The headers from the HTTP request.

block.para: If you override this property in a derived class, you must manually check the data for potential cross-site scripting attacks.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string this[string field] { get; }
Default Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Item(field As String) As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ default[System::String ^] { System::String ^ get(System::String ^ field); };

Docs.param: The key of the object to retrieve.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the specified object from the , , , or collection, without triggering ASP.NET request validation.
Docs.value: The object specified by the parameter.

block.para: If you override this property in a derived class, you must manually check the data for potential cross-site scripting attacks.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Path As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ Path { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the virtual path of the requested resource without triggering ASP.NET request validation.

block.para: If you override this property in a derived class, you must manually check the data for potential cross-site scripting attacks.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property PathInfo As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ PathInfo { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets additional path information for a resource that has a URL extension, without triggering ASP.NET request validation.
Docs.value: A string that contains additional path information for a resource.

block.para: If you override this property in a derived class, you must manually check the data for potential cross-site scripting attacks.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property QueryString As NameValueCollection

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the collection of HTTP query string variables that the client submitted, without triggering ASP.NET request validation.
Docs.value: The collection of query string variables sent by the client.

block.para: If you override this property in a derived class, you must manually check the data for potential cross-site scripting attacks.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property RawUrl As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ RawUrl { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the part of the requested URL that follows the website name, without triggering ASP.NET request validation.
Docs.value: The part of the URL that follows the website name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the complete request URL is `http://www.contoso.com/default.aspx?id=44`, the value of <xref:System.Web.UnvalidatedRequestValuesBase.RawUrl%2A> is `/default.aspx?id=44`.

block.para: If you override this property in a derived class, you must manually check the data for potential cross-site scripting attacks.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Url As Uri
public: virtual property Uri ^ Url { Uri ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the URL data for the request without triggering request validation.
Docs.value: An object that contains the URL data for the request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can retrieve URL data such as the port number, host name, path information, and data about the user from the <xref:System.Uri> object that this property returns.

block.para: If you override this property in a derived class, you must manually check the data for potential cross-site scripting attacks.
